all_questions.question: What is the name of the byte-per-encoding method mentioned in the document?
all_questions.context: There is also Google Word pieces which were introduced for speech processing around the same year.

all_questions.question: How does the STE (sub-bord text encoder) handle word boundaries?
all_questions.context: STE has always added an underscore at the end of the word.

all_questions.question: Why is it beneficial for models to share subwords like 'tramvaj' across sentences?
all_questions.context: This sharing of this unit, the fact that you observe the word tramvaj, the token tramvaj, in both of these sentences, gives the model the necessary generalization power.

all_questions.question: How does BPE (byte-per-encoding) handle empty suffixes?
all_questions.context: If you use the BPE in its default variation, bliží se kto be tramvaj, stramvaj nevy stoupil, then unfortunately there is no way to separate an empty suffix.

all_questions.question: What happens when the underscores are added before processing with BPE?
all_questions.context: If we add the underscores before processing the corpus with the BPE, and we can be lucky now. This tramvaj will get the ampersand as an unfinished word.
